descriptionHTML:
The one-and-only remote control app for your computer. Turns your device into a WiFi or Bluetooth universal remote control for Windows PC, Mac and Linux. Be lazy, you deserve it! Preloaded with support for 90+ programs including mouse & keyboard, media players, presentations, screen mirroring, power control, file manager, terminal, and much more.

Server: https://www.unifiedremote.com

“Fantastic tool for those of you who want to have a remote control for their computer for watching TV, or maybe for listening to music.” – Gizmodo

Key Features
• Easy server and app setup, that just works.
• Automatic server detection to easily find servers on your network.
• Server password protection and encryption for added security.
• Supports single and multi-touch mouse control.
• Wake On LAN to easily start your server.
• Includes light and dark color themes.
• Server is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux.
• Control other devices including Raspberry Pi and Arduino Yún.
• 18 free remotes

Full Version Features
• 90+ remotes
• Floating Remotes (use remotes over other apps)
• Custom Remotes
• Widgets & Quick Actions
• Voice commands
• Custom remotes
• IR actions
• NFC actions
• Android Wear (Quick Actions, Voice & Mouse)
• No upgrade hints

Essentials
Mouse, Keyboard, Screen, Volume, and more.

Music
Spotify, iTunes, Google Music, Winamp, etc.

Video
VLC, BSPlayer, Windows Media Player, PotPlayer, etc.

Media Center
Kodi (XBMC), Plex, Windows Media Center, Boxee, etc.

Streaming
YouTube, Netflix, Hulu

Presentations
PowerPoint, Keynote, Google Presentation

Browsers
Chrome, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Opera

Other
Power, Monitor, Files, Task Manager, Commands, etc.

All Remotes
https://www.unifiedremote.com/remotes

Note that some remotes are not available for all operating systems.

Permissions
• system alert window: for floating remotes.
• read phone status: for auto-pause when receiving calls.
• control NFC: for NFC actions.
• full network access: for server connection.
• view network connections: for server connection.
• view Wi-Fi connections: for server connection.
• pair with Bluetooth devices: for server connection.
• control vibration: for optional haptic feedback.
• prevent phone from sleeping: for optional wake-lock.
• transmit infrared: for IR remote control.
• install shortcuts: for launcher shortcuts.
comments: Not a bad app. Sometimes I want to enjoy watching Netflix or Hulu without getting up. It's also pretty good with Spotify since non premium membership using skip on the Spotify app to control the Spotify on my PC is limited.   However on my Huawei Honor 6. I have to move the mouse pointer slow otherwise the mouse pointer doesn't register my swipes.

I've always wanted a TV remote for my PC with flashing animated ads that loses connection if more than thirty seconds passes. Lovely minimalist app with fifty menus and wonderfully designed interfaces that make controlling my computer like raking nails down a chalkboard. I'm concerned that your marketspace might be edged out by the fifty foot USB cable, or one of the hundreds of identical apps on the app store. You should make a remote app for every device in my house! Now all I have to do is press 5 small targets on screen, and pray to cthulu, and I can control my toaster. Or is the toaster roaster controller going to be in the paid version of your next app?

This app works, but when I want to scroll, it pinch zooms, even when I've turned it off.   Edit: I found a scroll wheel function, but using the 2 finger scroll method would be easier if it didn't think I was pinching to zoom in or out (bare in mind that I turned off the pinch to zoom option in the mouse settings).  A suggestion I would make is a forward or back button for web browsing. Having to use my mouse to click back can become repetitive, especially when you're sitting quite far from the screen; it is a pretty small icon.

Best available in my search. Easy interface. Not smooth mouse movement as compare to others but it doesn't mean you can't control it. Other smoothness giving apps hangs after some time and we have to wait for it to reconnect. But this app is not hanging this is big plus.

Asks every time I open it if I want to upgrade which is annoying. On top of that there are intrusive ads on the mouse control screen. So if I'm on the couch trying to control my PC, it will suddenly stop working and I look down at the phone, there is a full size ad covering the screen. No thanks.
Remote Desktop (Chrome)  allows full access and mirroring free, no ads!  Drawback; process to get set up, and only one can access at a time.
